Employee Contribution: Section 3101 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to reduce the tax rate on employees for Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance in years following a reduction year. The reduction year is defined as any year after the transition year when the OASDI rate ratio exceeds 125 percent. The reduction percentage is the difference between the rate in effect for the reduction year and the rate that would result in an OASDI rate ratio of 125 percent. The OASDI rate ratio is calculated as the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund for any calendar year. The OASDI rate ratio is the ratio of the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund to the amount paid from these Trust Funds for authorized purposes in a calendar year, excluding certain transfers.
